prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** This part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions are approximately 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 This coordinate system will be used to draw the 2D sketch that will be transformed into a 3D model. The sketch will be drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch has one face (face\_1) and one loop (loop\_1) consisting of five lines. The lines have the following start and end points: - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.5282) - Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.5282), End Point (0.375, 0.75) - Line 4: Start Point (0.375, 0.75), End Point (0.0, 0.5282) - Line 5: Start Point (0.0, 0.5282), End Point (0.0, 0.0) The loop is closed, and it cannot consist of a line and a circle, or an arc and a circle. After creating the 2D sketch, it needs to be scaled using the sketch\_scale scaling parameter. The scaling parameter is 0.75. The scaled 2D sketch is then transformed into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Finally, the 2D sketch is extruded to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.0118, and the extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0.0. The resulting part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions are approximately 2 units by 3 units by 4 units.</description>
